items.text: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.
items.plainText: A Psalm of David, when he fled from Absalom his son.

items.text: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.
items.plainText: LORD, how are they increased that trouble me! many are they that rise up against me.

items.text: Many there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.
items.plainText: Many there be which say of my soul, There is no help for him in God. Selah.

items.text: But thou, O LORD, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.
items.plainText: But thou, O LORD, art a shield for me; my glory, and the lifter up of mine head.

items.text: I cried unto the LORD with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.
items.plainText: I cried unto the LORD with my voice, and he heard me out of his holy hill. Selah.

items.text: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the LORD sustained me.
items.plainText: I laid me down and slept; I awaked; for the LORD sustained me.

items.text: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.
items.plainText: I will not be afraid of ten thousands of people, that have set themselves against me round about.

items.text: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.
items.plainText: Arise, O LORD; save me, O my God: for thou hast smitten all mine enemies upon the cheek bone; thou hast broken the teeth of the ungodly.

items.text: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
items.plainText: Salvation belongeth unto the LORD: thy blessing is upon thy people. Selah.
